channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Facebook owner Meta forms data-sharing pact with UK banks to counter scams
item.description: Meta is working with U.K. banks NatWest and Metro Bank on an information-sharing agreement to help them prevent customers from falling victim to fraud...

item.title: Wednesday's analyst calls: Nike earnings reaction, Harley-Davidson gets a downgrade
item.description: An apparel giant and a motorcycle maker were among the stocks being talked about by analysts on Wednesday.

item.title: Hurricane Helene shuts down critical mines, endangering AI chip supply
item.description: The two mines provide high-purity quartz for semiconductors.

item.title: Goldman-backed Starling Bank hit with $38.5 million fine for financial crime prevention failures
item.description: London's Financial Conduct Authority said it has fined Starling "for financial crime failings related to its financial sanctions screening."

item.title: Longtime China bull Ray Dalio says Beijing now has to chose between ‘beautiful deleveraging’ and economic malaise
item.description: Billionaire investor Dalio says Beijing’s ‘big week’ of stimulus could be one for the history books

item.title: Bill Gates is open to losing $101 billion to the tax man—but not policies that replicate North Korea’s ‘unbelievable equality’
item.description: Gates said he would support a tax policy which took away 62% of his fortune—worth $101 billion.

item.title: How to make smart Medicare Open Enrollment choices for 2025
item.description: “It's going to be challenging,” says expert Philip Moeller, who urges people to take their time.

item.title: European markets slip lower on Middle East tensions; defense stocks rally
item.description: European stocks shifted lower in late morning trade Wednesday as investors assessed escalating tensions in the Middle East.

item.description: Harris and Trump are trying to reshape investment and redistribute income and economic activity to their favored sectors.
